subtitle: An East Indian dish using thick coconut milk. Popular in South Indian cuisine but dishes using cooked fish are traditionally cooked in the East.

method.text: Melt the ghee or butter in a saucepan. Add the onion, garlic and chilli. Fry for 3 min until soft.
Add the turmeric and saffron. Fry for 2 min, stirring constantly. Add the coconut milk and vinegar. Simmer very GENTLY for 10 min, until thickened slightly.
Add the fish to the sauce. Heat gently until piping hot, not stirring otherwise the fish will break up.
Scatter the coriander over to serve.

title: Muchli molee (spiced fish with coconut)
